fields.title: About
fields.content:
BioMart is a freely available, open-source, query oriented federated data management system developed jointly by the Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (OICR) and the European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI). Originally developed for the Ensembl genome browser as the EnsMart data warehouse, BioMart has now become a generic data management and federation system, and as of August 2011, has been adapted by 37 biological databases and 5 specialized data portals (ICGC Data Portal, BioMart Central Portal, PopCure, Digital Medicine, IKMC Portal). The latest BioMart release (BioMart 0.8) has been enhanced with many new features and extensions summarized below. For a comprehensive description of BioMart 0.8, please refer to Zhang et al., (2011) BioMart: a data federation framework for large collaborative projects. Database, and to the BioMart 0.8 rc6 User Manual. 

In a nutshell, a BioMart dataset is a collection of filters and attributes, organized in a query optimized relational database. Attributes are data elements that users can retrieve from the system (e.g. Ensembl gene ID, genomic position). Filters are criteria that are used to restrict the query (e.g. Protein coding genes on chromosome 1). BioMart can automatically convert any 3NF database into a BioMart dataset using the MartConfigurator tool. Once the BioMart dataset is created, MartConfigurator is then used to configure the BioMart dataset, which generally involves: 1) selecting how filters and attributes are organized and presented, 2. selecting which graphical and/or programmatic interfaces are used to interact with the data, and 3. implementing security features to control access to all or parts of the data. Filters and attributes can also be imported from another dataset (local or external) if the two datasets can be linked through a common key. For instance, in a gene annotation dataset, a pathway filter can be imported from a pathway dataset as long as both datasets share a common data element, such as Entrez gene ID. With this imported filter, users can retrieve genes that are involved in user specified pathway(s). Once the configuration is complete, the BioMart server is deployed directly from MartConfigurator or via a command-line script. Once deployed, a BioMart web application will open in a browser, allowing the administrator to see exactly how the final deployment will appear to users. 

KEY FEATURES

  • Data agnostic and platform independent, and can be easily adopted to existing databases. Currently supported RDBMS platforms are: MS SQL Server, DB2, MySQL, Oracle, and Postgres. 
  • Built-in support for query optimization to efficiently manage data retrieval from large datasets. 
  • Built-in support for database federation. Thus, it can provide unified access to data from distributed sources and to integrate data from existing BioMart datasets and in-house sources.
  • BioMart installation can provide domain-specific querying of a single data source (e.g. WormMart, Ensembl Mart), or function as a data portal to a wide range of BioMart sources (e.g. ICGC Data Portal, BioMart Central Portal). 
  • BioMart 0.8 supports enterprise level security features (HTTPS, OpenID and oAuth protocols) for managing sensitive data.
  • Offers a diverse selection of graphical query interfaces, and programmatic query interfaces (SQL querying method that can be accessed via REST or SOAP requests, a Java API, and RDF querying via SPARQL). Furthermore, BioMart includes an extendable plugin framework for analysis and visualization. 
  • A single intuitive tool, MartConfigurator, is used for building a BioMart data source, configuring query interfaces, and deploying a BioMart server. 
  • Has been incorporated into a number of external software packages: Bioclipse, BioExtract, biomaRt-BioConductor, Taverna, Cytoscape, Galaxy, Gitools, Ruby API, WebLab. Thus, data contained in the BioMart Central Portal can be exported and analyzed using the services provided by these software packages.  BioMart is also part of the Generic Model Organism Database (GMOD) suite of tools for building a model organism site.

BioMart Central Portal

BioMart Central Portal is a first-of-its-kind, community-driven effort to provide unified access to dozens of biological databases spanning genomics, proteomics, model organisms, ontology information, cancer, and more (see complete list). BioMart Central Portal does not store any data locally. Instead it provides access to variety of data using a federated approach, linking data from distributed sources located at different geographical locations. All databases contained in the Central Portal are maintained and managed independently. In this model, the underlying data remain autonomous, but the availability of these resources and the instruction for interacting with them are accessible from a central location.

For data providers, participation in BioMart Central Portal offers several benefits: they can retain full control of their database/data while exposing it to a wider user base; they are able to link their data with other member databases providing an instantly-available and automatically updated source of annotations; and, joining the BioMart community allows data providers to take advantage of the tools and plugins that other members have created, thereby enhancing their own databases.

For users, BioMart Central Portal offers several benefits: the ability to query a vast array of biological data through a single access point; multiple query interfaces allow users to browse and retrieve data from one or multiple datasets in a simple and efficient manner; query interfaces are consistent across all databases, so users familiar with one source can immediately transfer their skills to another data source; and, because BioMart Central Portal is constantly updated, users are immediately exposed to new resources as they become available. 

For a comphrehensive description of the BioMart Central Portal, please refer to Guberman JM, et al. (2011) BioMart Central Portal: An Open Databse Network for the Biological Community. Database.

Funding

The development of the BioMart software and the creation and hosting of BioMart Central Portal is supported by the Ontario Institute for Cancer Research and the Ontario Ministry for Research and Innovation. The individual data sources that the Central Portal comprises are funded separately and independently.

fields.title: BioMart Central Portal
fields.content:
BioMart central portal is a unified access point to diverse public databases with BioMart installations (See complete list).

OPTION 1: Query data through MartView

The web interface used by many existent BioMarts, and most familiar to the users, is called MartView (powered by BioMart 0.7). For a comprehensive description of MartView refer to: Haider S, et al. [Pubmed] ).

Access MartView

OPTION 2: Query data through BioMart Central Portal

In August 2011, we  have created a new BioMart Central Portal powered by the latest (BioMart 0.8) technology. BioMart Central Portal has the same data content as MartView. However, certain features such as query processing and query interfaces have been upgraded to enhance query speed and performance, and to improve query flexibility.  For a comprehensive description of the BioMart Central Portal refer to: Guberman JM,  et al. [Pubmed]

Access BioMart Central Portal

We would greatly  appreciate your feedback on our new central portal. Please contact us with any questions, comments, or improvement ideas.

fields.title: Documentation
fields.content:
User Manuals

One of our most valuable user documents are the user manuals. For questions related to BioMart 0.8 or the BioMart Central Portal refer to the BioMart 0.8 User Manual. For questions related to BioMart version 0.7 or older, refer to the BioMart 0.7 User Manual. Please look through the manuals and contact us if you have any questions. 

Tutorials and Presentations

1. BioMart 0.8: New tools, more interfaces, and increased flexibility through plugins. 

DOWNLOAD (10.4Mb)

2. BioMart Central Portal: An Open Database network for the biological community.

DOWNLOAD (3.4Mb)

3. ICGC Data Portal: A One-stop shop for cancer genomics data

DOWNLOAD (4.8Mb)

4. A selection of printed and video tutorials on Ensembl Mart (Flash animations and printable courses in PDF) produced by the Ensembl team are available here. 

5. Solved examples from Ensembl Mart (MartView) are available here. 

6. On-line BioMart tutorial and other training resources from OpenHelix

We are gradually adding to the list, so please check back regularly.

Publications

This is a list of publications describing BioMart contributed by past and present members of the BioMart team. Many existing publications describing databases with BioMart installations are not included in the list. 

  1. Zhang J, Haider S, Baran J, Cros A, Guberman JM, Hsu J, Liang Y, Yao L, Kasprzyk A. BioMart: a data federation framework for large collaborative projects. Database. 2011 
  2. Guberman JM, Ai J, Baran J., et al. BioMart Central Portal: An Open Database Network for the Biological Community. Database. 2011.
  3. Zhang J, Baran J, Guberman JM, Haider, S, Hsu J, Liang Y, Rivkin E, Wang J, Whitty B, Wong-Erasmus M, Yao L, Kasprzyk A. International Cancer Genome Consortium Data Portal - a One-stop Shop for Cancer Genomics Data. Database. 2011
  4. Haider S, Ballester B, Smedley D, Zhang J, Rice P, Kasprzyk A. BioMart Central Portal—unified access to biological data. Nucleic Acids Res. 2009 July 1;37(Web Server issue):W23-7. [Pubmed]
  5. Smedley D, Haider S, Ballester B, Holland R, London D, Thorisson G, Kasprzyk A. BioMart - biological queries made easy. BMC Genomics. 2009 Jan 14;10:22. [Pubmed]
  6. Durinck S, Moreau Y, Kasprzyk A, Davis S, De Moor B, Brazma A, Huber W. BioMart and Bioconductor: a powerful link between biological databases and microarray data analysis. Bioinformatics. 2005 Aug 15;21(16):3439-40. [Pubmed]
  7. Kasprzyk A, Keefe D, Smedley D, London D, Spooner W, Melsopp C, Hammond M, Rocca-Serra P, Cox T, Birney E. EnsMart: A Generic System for Fast and Flexible Access to Biological Data. Genome Res. 2004 Jan; 14(1):160-169. [Pubmed] 
  8. Gilbert, D. Shopping in the genome market with EnsMart. Brief Bioinform. 2003 Sep;4(3):292-6. [Pubmed]

Citing BioMart

To cite BioMart 0.7 or older versions:

  1. Haider S, Ballester B, Smedley D, Zhang J, Rice P, Kasprzyk A. BioMart Central Portal—unified access to biological data. Nucleic Acids Res. 2009 July 1;37(Web Server issue):W23-7. [Pubmed]
  2. Smedley D, Haider S, Ballester B, Holland R, London D, Thorisson G, Kasprzyk A. BioMart - biological queries made easy. BMC Genomics. 2009 Jan 14;10:22. [Pubmed]

To cite BioMart 0.8:

Zhang J, Haider S, Baran J, Cros A, Guberman JM, Hsu J, Liang Y, Yao L, Kasprzyk A. BioMart: a data federation framework for large collaborative projects. Database. 2011 

To cite BioMart Central Portal:

Guberman JM, Ai J, Baran J., et al. BioMart Central Portal: An Open Database Network for the Biological Community. Database. 2011.

NOTE: When referencing information obtained in a search of the BioMart Central Portal it should be remembered that BioMart is not responsible for the data content, and only primary sources of information should be cited.

fields.title: Presentations
fields.content:
1. BioMart 0.8: New tools, more interfaces, and increased flexibility through plugins. 

DOWNLOAD Presentation (26 Slides, 11.5MB)

2. BioMart Central Portal: An Open Database Network for the Biological Community. Describes the structure of the Central POrtal and show example queries to demonstrates its capabilities. 

DOWNLOAD presentaiton (x slides, yMB)

3. ICGC Data Portal:

fields.title: Download
fields.content:
BioMart is completely open-source under the LGPL License, and freely available to anyone without restriction. There are currently two BioMart versions available for installation. The software/server prerequisites differ depending on which version of BioMart you would like to install. Please refer to the corresponding software documentation for details. 

OPTION 1. Get the latest development version (recommended)

The latest BioMart version, BioMart 0.8 (release candidate 6) is a Java application. All the required components can be downloaded using the following command:

svn checkout https://code.oicr.on.ca/svn/biomart/biomart-java/branches/release-0_8-candidate_6/

See the BioMart 0.8 User Manual for further instruction.

We constantly strive to improve the BioMart software based on the information we recieve from its users, and your feedback is greatly appreciated. Please contact us with any questions, comments, or improvement ideas. 

OPTION 2. Get the latest official version 

The latest official version, BioMart 0.7, is written in Perl and Java and is distributed in several packages. 

See the BioMart 0.7 Quick install guide OR

See the complete BioMart 0.7 documentation for detailed instruction.

fields.title: Support
fields.content:
The BioMart project has two mailing lists:

USERS LIST is used for all questions, comments, and development discussions related to either the BioMart software or to the BioMart Central Portal. 

To subscribe to USERS mailing list or to view list archives visit: 

https://lists.biomart.org/mailman/listinfo/users

To submit a question, post comments or improvement suggestions to the list, send email to users@biomart.org

ANNOUNCE LIST is used for occasional announcements on the BioMart project. This is a low traffic list excellent for people who just want occasional news about the project. 

To subscribe to ANNOUNCE mailing list or to view list archives visit:

https://lists.biomart.org/mailman/listinfo/announce

To post a message to the list, send email to announce@biomart.org

For any other inquiries, or if you would like to advertise your BioMart website, please contact arek.kasprzyk@gmail.com. We will be happy to hyperlink your BioMart website from our home page and provide access to it through our BioMart Central Portal. 

NOTE: BioMart is a software development project and we are very happy to provide as much support as we can on various aspects of BioMart installation and troubleshooting. For all the data related questions concerning individual BioMart instances you should contact the appropriate team directly (e.g. Ensembl: helpdesk@ensembl.org)
